snippet: Citing concerns that its smoke and carbon monoxide detector might be unintentionally turned off, Nest Labs is halting sales of the product and disabling a feature that allows users to turn it off with a wave.
abstract: Nest Labs, home automation company recently acquired by Google for $3.2 billion, will halt sales of its smoke and carbon monoxide detector over safety concerns; will also disable feature that allows users to turn it off with a wave; problems are rare blemish for company known for care it puts into products.
lead_paragraph: Citing concerns that its smoke and carbon monoxide detector might be unintentionally turned off, Nest Labs is halting sales of the product and disabling a feature that allows users to turn it off with a wave.

headline.main: Nest Labs Stops Selling Its Smoke Detector
headline.print_headline: Nest Labs Stops Selling Its Smoke Detector
